author: Sports Chaser
comment: Love the app.  I use it to track every round I play.  Only minor glitch is putting in hole by hole score ..... when you get to hole 18 it doesn't tab down to the putt tab automatically so you accidently put the number of putts on the hole for your score.  Seems would be an easy fix.  All in all its a keeper.  Definately hope the little putt score situation on hole 18 is fixed soon......also interested in further comlplex fun adjunct development.

author: Paul Goodwin
comment: love the App. occasionally it crashes but it saves the data so you don't lose everything. worst case I update online. the online app is great. lots of analysis.

author: Allen Buchanan
comment: It won't let me enter scores.  Paid for 3 years.  Entered scores for 2 months.  Now it won't allow it.  Emailed support twice with no answer.  Updated my AP.  Still doesn't work.

author: Jon Adams
comment: Downloaded the app, got to the log on and register page, wud not set up to facebook as said couldnt due to the app, went to register myself and it would not accept my postcode no matter how i presented it, with spaces n without, cap/lower case and just first 3 letters

author: Michael Vanderslice
comment: Worked well the first year but I ran into an issue with the app during renewal. Been paying for a year and can't get it working and support claims I haven't paid even after showing them my receipt. They've become unresponsive or slow to respond. Can't recommend.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Michael,

We just put out a new release of the app last weekend.  We hope that it is now working for you.  We apologize sincerely for the slow turnaround time and hope you will give it a second chance.

Thanks,
Bob

author: Tim B
comment: I liked the app...until I got my 5 scores in! Wasn't sure I wanted to keep the app because it's not tied into the GHIN system.   Now I can't even go in to see what my prior scores are!  Unfortunately, 'Myscorecard' has convinced me not to purchase

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Tim,

We are sorry to hear this.  We have released a new version of the app today that will hopefully fix any issues you were having.

Thanks,
Bob

author: Neal Dunaway
comment: I've had this app for at least 4 years. It was very good until an update that screwed it up. It now won't format correctly on my S5 and is a joke. Total waste of money

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Neal,

We are working on fixing this.  The new build should be out shortly.  My apologies.

Thanks,
Bob

title: Poor formatting

author: Chris Gigstad
comment: I love this app, but it has stopped working for me now.  It says my subscription is expired, but it isn't!  It won't let me log in or use it anymore...  very frustrating.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Chris,

Let us know what is going wrong with your app and we will try to resolve.  Sorry for the delay onb this.  If you reach out to support@myscorecard.com you will get a much quicker response.

Thanks,
Bob

author: Scott Moeszinger
comment: Worked good until I renewed my subscription.  Now, the App will not open.  Uninstalling did not help.  Contacted Myscorecard but did not recieve any help.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Scott,

We released a new version of the app today.  Let me know if this fixes your problem.  So sorry about the delayed response.

Thanks,
Bob

author: Danny McCullough
comment: Very useful app. However, two days ago it quit registering scorecards on my local courses, saying the course doesn't exist. This, even though I have successfully used my scorecard on this course several times previously. Please fix. Otherwise, I would rete 5 stars.  Addendum 8/27/16:. Received prompt response from developer, who fixed the issue. No problems with app now.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: HI Danny, That was a temporary issue as we were adding a new feature that would show your stats on that course. It should now be fixed. Apologies for the inconvenience and we welcome any other feedback you have.

title: Worked well until recently

author: Jody Quinlan
comment: Worked fine until I paid my money after putting in 5 scores it want let my put my scores in from the same course. Says no tee information available. So I emailed customer  service and no response. Fixed the problem works great now.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Hi Jody, We just wrote you back. We do our best to get back to our users within 24 hours with a resolution and sent you an email on this topic. That was a temporary issue as we were adding a new feature that would show your stats on that course. It should now be fixed. Apologies for the inconvenience and we welcome any other feedback you have.

title: Bad don't waste your money

author: john marcelia
comment: App works just fine on my phone but I get an error "unfortunately MyScorecard has stopped" about every 20min on my moto360 2gen.  Got to uninstall till issue is fixed.  Bummer

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
John,  

This issue should be resolved in the newest update.  There was an issue with the mapping feature on the watch that was fixed.  Let us know if this is still crashing for you, and we will get it fixed ASAP.

Thanks,
Bob

title: App was ok but now crashes on my Moto360 watch

comment: It worked fine with my home course then as of yesterday my course has no numbers and doesn't exist  NOT HAPPY

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Thanks for your note. That was a temporary issue as we were adding a new feature that would show your stats on that course. It should now be fixed. Apologies for the inconvenience and we welcome any other feedback you have.

title: Not happy

author: Don Carney
comment: I originally bought this app in June 2015. For the first year I loved it and got several of my golf buddies on the same app. It automatically renewed on June 7, 2016, but, since that time I have not been able to access the app to upload new scores or even view the app to transfer my data. When I try to click it on, it says that my membership has expired; when I click on purchase membership I get an error message that says "You're already subscribed to one year subscription". Then I click OK and it says that PlayStore reported a cancelled purchase (which I did not do) . When I go to PlayStore it says I am paid up until June 7, 2017.??? I have reached out to the vendor and to Google for help. I have not had a response from either. If this cannot be fixed I would NOT recommend this app because I have now  lost a year's worth of scores and am now starting all over. Very frustrating!!

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Don,
We have sent back a reply via our email system.  Just making sure that we close the loop on this here.  I believe uninstalling and reinstalling the app should fix your issue.   You can also log in via the website to verify all your rounds are there.  They will be, as we save everything to our secure servers, not just on the app.
Thanks, Bob

author: Jason Franklin
comment: Just ridiculous that the android watch App is a  $50 purchase. If you're paying for a subscription the app should be a part of the subscription. Sure it's only 15 a year. But come on guys. 50 add on to use my smart watch? No thanks.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Jason,  

The watch app is currently being offered at $29.99.  We are trying to find the sweet spot of how much development time we are needing to put into this vs. how much we are charging for it.

Thanks,
Bob

title: Watch App

author: Dave Wiens
comment: Won't accept my canadian postal code to register

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Dave, you should be able to register on the website at www.myscorecard.com and then login through the app.  Sorry about the issue, we will try to get a fix out for this ASAP.

author: David Normington
comment: Everything was fine and I have loved the app but after the latest updates any time I open the app to add a score I get an error message "Unfortunately Myscorecard is not responding" and it shuts down. I have un/reinstalled to no avail. Please help.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: David,  We just pushed out a fix for these crashes.  Version 2.0.28 should be available in the next hour.  Sorry for the inconvenience.

title: Great app when working.

author: Scott Kellerer
comment: Good app

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Scott, We ran into issues with a google SDK.  If you download the newest version you should be back to good!

author: Patrick Burnham
comment: For the course I play most, the app has the 9's flipped on the map, but not in the list.   I live on 16, which is a 175 yard par 3.  The map shows as a par 3, but lists as a par 4.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Patrick, send us an email to support@myscorecard.com and we can try to resolve this for you.  We aim to be the most accurate golf app out there.

title: Looks useful, but not accurate.

author: Don Turner
comment: Love the new look and the added capabilities!
title: Much improved

author: Pratyush Midha
comment: Useful and value for money

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: We have released a new version that should be available in the next few hours.  We hope that it solves your issues.  There may still be some font issues on your particular device, but we did fix it on the handicap cards, and hole by hole should not crash now.  Feel free to email us if these issues still occur for you.

author: Clint Wilber
comment: There have been some upgrades but I don't see the functionality as being that improved. Added some new scoring abilities and a range finder that doesn't work for me because the screen is blank. Needs live leaderboard tournament scoring. Looks much better though.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Clint, thanks for your feedback. We'll follow up directly with you regarding what functionality you would like to see.

We have also just pushed a fix, so the maps should now be working!

title: Two stars for a solid start

author: Simon Marques
comment: Works well with very dedicated developers, wish you could edit/ enter course manually that are not supported directly from the app without having to go to the website. That would earn five stars!

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Simon, it should be fixed.  Google released a new version of their SDK and it broke a few things on our end.  We will try to get the manual adding of courses in the app for you shortly.

title: Revised: Good Score Tracking App

author: B Rhods
comment: Back to greatness.
title: Working fine after my phone software update

comment: Useless.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: It does require an account, but you can try it out for free for 30 days to decide if you like our features.

title: Requires account

author: Whitney Smith
comment: Updated to most recent app in case it was my issue, but just wont work. I login and it stops me on a page saying I have to sign up for a yearly membership. I already have a paid membership and it is good another 2 months. There is no option to click through or access my account or scores at all. Pretty useless at this point.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Whitney, this was an issue on tablets and it should now be resolved.

title: App doesn't work

author: Motorrad Fahrer
comment: I'm having the same issue as Whitney Smith.  My Samsung S5 isn't running the app properly.   My Toshiba tablet runs the app just fine.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Motorrad, we pushed out a fix over the last couple of days that should have resolved this.  Let us know if that is not the case.

title: Same as Whitney Smith

author: Adam Gardner
comment: 2016 and still no Material Design for a recent application update. UI still has issues, QA, QA, QA guys. Around me works which is nice. 50 bucks for the watch app? Come on now, as a Android developer all you are doing is passing the strings for those fields to a small Android Wear native app and displaying them. Your hitting the same web service.  50 bucks for that? Give me a break.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Adam what issues are you running into?  Are they cosmetic, or are you experiencing crashes.  We have begun to build out our material design.  The entire system is now card based, we are using floating action buttons, and are trying to uniform the experience across both iOS and Android.

title: Holy gawd

author: Tom Gonyea
comment: You have ruined the app. It used to be easy to use and easy to add scores the courses or tee boxes that weren't standard. Now it appears you can't. Can't believe you thought this was better.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Tom,

Let us know how the process used to work for you.  We should be able to provide an update for you on this quickly to help it work for you.

title: This sucks

author: Chuck Sallade
comment: Getting better with time though....you may need to uninstall and reinstall if it acts up

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Thanks Chuck.  We have a lot of great things in the pipeline as well.  Feel free to shoot us an email for features that you think will warrant a five star review.

title: Could be better

author: L W
comment: This app was great until the recent changes.  I paid for my new subscription weeks age and still don't have access to the app

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: We have released a new version that should be available in the next few hours.  We hope that it solves your issues.  And if you are still having issues with your subscription, you can reach out to us directly in email from the app and we can get you squared away.

title: Too much

author: Doug McILwraith
comment: Simple and easy to use. I don't play in tournaments but like to keep track of my handicap.
title: Great App

author: Shawn Garcia
comment: Get app and gives you everything. Love the team portfolio also.
title: Shawn

author: William Harnedy
comment: Good  app so far

author: Tom Newman
comment: New update looks great.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Hi Tom - I believe our follow-up solved your issue. Let us know if you run into any other difficulties.

author: Bruce Gagnon
comment: Member for 8years. Easy to use and gives all the info. I need.

author: Chad Baer
comment: Fixed the bugs. Use it almost everytime on a course instead of paper. Great way to submit/track qualified scores towards your index.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: Thanks for the updated review Chad, we're working on a number of features that we're excited about. We welcome any other feedback on what you'd like to see - just email us direclty

title: Good index tracker and e-scorecard

author: Mike Donnellan
comment: Shuts down entering hole by hole.  Advances holes without taking putts so you have to scroll back.  Old app was much better.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Mike,

We have released a new version that should be available in the next few hours.  We hope that it solves your issues.  It should be much more stable and provide much more use than the old app.

title: Unstable

author: Vincent Vigliaturo
comment: Great app for entering and looking up handicap great customer service. App needs addition of features availiable on the full Web page like groups/clubs and analytics

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content:
Vincent,

We have added in more club capabilities on the app and have begun providing analytics.  If you would like to, you can email us about different analytics you would like to see, as we are in the process of prioritizing them for the mobile apps.

title: Good app needs more features

author: Chadwyck Reynolds
comment: App works well as far as entering rounds but once I have a scorecard entered stroke by stroke why can't I pull it back up to reference or show someone else? I mean C'mon. Seems like that would be easy to fix and a no brainer.

reply.author: MyScorecard
reply.content: We have added round history, so you can do just that.  Give it a try!

title: Good App
